^x70FF70How to Start This Build^7
This build requires ~^xFFFF77Level 80^7 at a minimum to play. Since this is a build that requires expensive items to even work I am going to assume you have ~^xFFFF77100c^7 spare to buy leveling gear. The quickest way to level would be to follow ^xFFFF77Tytykillers Hollow Palm Leveling Guide^7.
All of the leveling uniques are going to cost ~^xFFFF77100c^7 and you can sell everything back to other people once you are done with it. Leveling like this will take anywhere from ^xFFFF772-5 Hours^7 depending on how good you are at leveling. I will not be including any other way to level in this guide, if you have a different way you enjoy leveling a ^xFFFF77Templar^7, do that instead to ^xFFFF77Level 80^7.
Once you are ^xFFFF7780^7 you can self level with the build just fine but if you wish to jump into the action ASAP, buy some 5-way carries to ^xFFFF77Level 90^7.
^xFFFF77Tytykiller's Leveling Guide^7: http://tinyurl.com/TyTyLevelingGuideV2
^x70FF70What Charms to Use^7
We will be using the ^xFFFF77Primalist Affliction Ascendancy^7 in this build giving us access to ^xFFFF773 Charm Slots^7 which can give us mini versions of other ^xFFFF77Ascendancies^7. There are a ton of useful options here but there is going to be one very specific roll we want on all of our charms.
There are only ^xFFFF77Two^7 charm rolls that I would say is mandatory in this build with the rest being pretty open in terms of what you can get.
You are going to want 1 of your 3 ^xFFFF77Charms^7 to have "^x8888FFx% of Leech is Instant^7" The closer you get this roll to ^xFFFF778%^7 the better as this will make a very big difference for both your ^x8888FFMana^7 sustain and your ^x7070FFEnergy Shield Leech^7. As long as you have this 1 ^xFFFF77Suffix^7 roll on any of your 3 ^xFFFF77Charms^7 you will have a smooth time. You can also consider running 2 of them which will give you greater ^x7070FFEnergy Shield Leech^7 and will help with ^x8888FFMana^7 drastically as you upgrade this build and gain ^x70FF70Attack Speed^7.
You are going to want 1 of your 3 ^xFFFF77Charms^7 to have "^x8888FFWarcries grant x Rage per 5 Power if you have less than 25 Rage^7" The roll on this ^xD02090DOES NOT^7 matter due to ^xAF6025Redblade Banner^7 giving you "^x8888FFWarcries have infinite Power^7." This means that even a bottom roll will always give you ^xE05030Maximum Rage^7 every time you use ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7.
You do not need to get these 2 charm rolls on your ^xFFFF77Primalist Charms^7. You can also get either or both of them on the unique jewel ^xAF6025That Which Was Taken^7. This would free up space on your other charms for the rolls below.
Outside of that, here are some useful mods you can consider on your charms. Again, none of these are mandatory but they are all good.
^xFFFF77Prefix:^7 "^x8888FFDamage Penetrates x% of Enemy Elemental Resistances^7" "^x8888FFCulling Strike^7"
^xFFFF77Suffix:^7 "^x8888FF+x to Strength and Intelligence^7" "^x8888FFGain x% of Maximum Mana as Extra Maximum Energy Shield^7" "^x8888FFRegenerate x% of Energy Shield per second^7" "^x8888FFx% chance to create Consecrated Ground when you Hit a Rare or Unique Enemy, lasting 8 seconds^7"
^x70FF70How to Play this Build^7
This build is very simple to play, at the most basic, you want to keep ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 up which is very easy to do given it lasts 15 seconds, press ^x8888FFArcane Cloak^7 on cooldown, and spam ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7.
This build is going to incorporate a ^xFFFF77Weapon Swap^7 to be able to fit all of the gems we need while also being able to fit in ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7. The ^xFFFF77Weapon Swap^7 is very important as it allows us to equip an ^xAF6025Al Dhih^7 for "^x8888FF25% increased Warcry Buff Effect^7" as well as a ^xE05030Redblade Banner^7 to make this build consistent.
^xE05030Warcries^7 work off of a "^xFFFF77Power^7" system where every mob that was within range of the ^xE05030Warcry^7 when you activate it will be assigned a ^xFFFF77Power Level^7 based on if they are ^xC8C8C8Normal^7, ^x8888FFMagic^7, ^xFFFF77Rare^7, or ^xAF6025Unique^7. In total we need ^xFFFF7730 Power^7 to gain the maximum effect of ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 which is where ^xD02090ALL^7 of our damage comes from. ^xAF6025Redblade Banner^7 makes this build not be clunky due to its "^x8888FFWarcries have infinite Power^7" line. This means that even if there are no monsters around you, ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 pretends you basically hit 1000000 monsters and gained 1000000 ^xFFFF77Power^7. Without this, you would basically never be able to reach the maximum effect of ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 without 50 mobs around you and is a ^xFFFF77DPS^7 increase on ^xFFFF77Bosses^7 as ^xAF6025Unique^7 monsters only give ^xFFFF7720^7 out of the ^xFFFF7730 Power^7 ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 needs.
One thing to mention is, that at much higher budget levels, you will do so much ^xFFFF77DPS^7 that ^xFFFF77Weapon Swapping^7 will not be required anymore for most trivial things and will only be needed for ^xFFFF77Bosses^7.
^xFFFF77TLDR^7:
1. Put ^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7 on ^xFFFF77Left Click^7 2. ^xFFFF77Weapon Swap^7 and use ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 3. Spam ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7
^x70FF70Arcane Cloak & Indigon Ramps^7
If you want a more in depth understanding of how exactly the damage in this build works, there is a section at the end of the ^xFFFF77Build Guide Video^7 linked at the top of this ^xFFFF77PoB^7 and on my ^xFFFF77YouTube^7.
^xD02090YOU DONT NEED TO KNOW ANY OF THIS, ITS JUST HERE FOR THE PEOPLE WHO WANT TO KNOW WHY THERE IS A RAMP IN THIS BUILD PLEASE DONT GET STRESSED OVER THIS AND THINK THE BUILD IS COMPLICATED
^xFFFF77A quick TLDR is^7:
^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7 is the main driver of spending your ^x8888FFMana^7 quickly for ^xAF6025Indigon^7. Its also going to be the driving force behind ramping your ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 ^x8888FFMana Cost^7 to high amounts. The first ^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7 will do very little damage, it's simply used to remove ^x8888FF65% of your Mana^7 to make ^xAF6025Indigon's^7 "^x8888FFIncreased Mana Cost per 200 Mana Spent Recently^7" scale hard instantly. This will make your ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 have a high base ^x8888FFMana Cost^7. This will let you spam it at a higher ^x8888FFMana Cost^7 sooner letting you scale ^xAF6025Indigon^7 faster.
What we want to happen is for you to reach ^x8888FFFull Mana^7 again by the time your 2nd ^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7 is off cooldown. At this point your ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 is costing ^x8888FF~200 Mana^7 instead of the base ^x8888FF~14 Mana^7. We are going to reach ^x8888FFFull Mana^7 through the "^x8888FFChance to gain 10% of Mana when You use a Skill^7"^xFFFF77 Mana Mastery^7 and later, which will be needed with higher ^x70FF70Attack Speed^7 values, the same mod on a ^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7. This will be combined with the "^x8888FF10% of Leech is Instant^7" ^xFFFF77Mastery^7 & the same mod on a ^xFFFF77Charm^7 will make sure you hit ^x8888FFMaximum Mana^7.
When you use your 2nd ^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7, you will remove ^x8888FF65% of your Mana^7 again, but because you still have a lot of ^x8888FFHigh Mana Cost^7 ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 built up, your ^x70FF70Rain of Arrow^7 Mana Costs will spike up to ^x8888FF~700-800 Mana^7. This is the insane ^xFFFF77DPS^7 you see in the ^xFFFF77B-Roll^7 at the start of my ^xFFFF77Video Guide^7. Its the 2nd ^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7 where ^x8888FFMana Costs^7 spike extremely hard and it pushes ^xAF6025Indigon^7 to its maximum capping out the scaling on the helmet.
^xD02090PLEASE READ THIS PART vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv PLEASE READ THIS PART vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv PLEASE READ THIS PART vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv^7
Just put ^x7070FFArcane Cloak^7 on ^xFFFF77Left Click^7 and you will just need to wait ^xFFFF774 Seconds^7 to do peak dps from a no combat/attacking scenario i.e walking into an invitation/boss room.
^x70FF70Mapping Setup^7
If you want to do maps with this build there is a very simple setup you can make to increase your ^xFFFF77Map Clear^7 by a large amount. All you have to do is swap ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 for ^x70FF70Lightning Arrow^7 and ^x70FF70Faster Attacks^7 for ^x70FF70Returning Projectiles^7.
^x70FF70Lightning Arrow^7 will be much better clear than ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 but it still won't be super amazing. At higher budget levels, you could even add in ^x70FF70Fork^7/^x70FF70Pierce^7 & ^x70FF70Faster Projectiles^7 when your damage is much higher and dropping some for clear oriented ^x70FF70Supports^7 is not much of an issue.
^x70FF70Gear^7
Basic overview of every slot and what to look for.
^xFFFF77IN GENERAL^7 - Fit ^xD02090Resistances^7 on your ^xFFFF77Boots^7, ^xFFFF77Rings^7 & ^xFFFF77Belt^7 This build will have some slight issues with fitting in all of your ^xD02090Resistances^7 due to there being so many ^xAF6025Unique^7 items in it. You will need ^xFFFF77Tier 1^7 & ^xFFFF77Tier 2^7 rolls to ^xD02090Res Cap^7 but one alternative you can try to do is to get ^xD02090Resistances^7 on your jewels which would overall give you weaker ones but it would make it easier to start.
Outside of ^xD02090Resistances^7, you want to try and fit Int and ^x8888FFMana^7 everywhere and ideally ^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7 but, your focus is ^x8888FFMana^7, as ^x8888FFMana^7 also gives you ^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7 & more damage.
^x70FF70Helmet^7
The only good Helmet in this build is ^xAF6025Indigon^7 and is absolutely mandatory for this build to work. ^xAF6025Indigon^7 is going to give this build a lot of "^x8888FF% increased Spell Damage^7" which will be converted into ^xE05030Physical Damage^7 through ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7.
This is where all of the scaling in this build comes from and you want to make sure to get a max roll of both the "^x8888FF% increased Spell Damage for each 200 total Mana you have Spent Recently, up to 2000%^7" and the "^x8888FF% increased Cost of Skills for each 200 total Mana Spent Recently^7" roll.
If you cannot afford a max rolled ^x8888FFCost^7 & ^x8888FFSpell Damage^7 ^xAF6025Indigon^7, then make sure to get a max rolled ^x8888FFSpell Damage^7 helmet and as high of a ^x8888FFCost of Skills^7 roll as you can afford.
^xD02090The difference between a min rolled Indigon and a max rolled Indigon is up to 30% of your dps.^7
Most of the corrupts don't matter as they give us very little benefit but if you'd like to look for one then the "^x8888FF% of Life per second^7" roll is great as it is turned into ^x7070FFEnergy Shield Regen^7 with ^xFFFF77Zealot's Oath^7.
^x70FF70Chest^7
The only good chest in this build is ^xAF6025The Ivory Tower^7. ^xAF6025Ivory Tower^7 provides us with a very large amount of ^x8888FFMana^7, ^x7070FFIntelligence^7, and a modest amount of ^x7070FFEnergy Shield Regen^7. ^xAF6025Ivory Tower^7 also makes us take ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 as ^x8888FFMana Damage^7 meaning we will not be killed in 1 second by any ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 dealt to us. This is not too relevant as we will be using the flask ^xAF6025Coruscating Elixir^7 to make all ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 not bypass our ^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7 but on bosses or situations where the flask isn't up this is needed.
Later on, you could get a ^xAF6025Sporeguard^7, anoint it with a ^xFFFF77Notable^7, corrupt it and hope it turns into a ^xFFFF77Rare^7 item, then ^xFFFF77Tainted Mythic Orb^7 it into an ^xAF6025Ivory Tower^7 giving you an ^xFFFF77Anointed^7 ^xAF6025Ivory Tower^7. That would be your ^xFFFF77BIS^7 chest by far in this build but the cost of undertaking such a task is easily ^xFFFF77200-300+ Div^7 and not something to worry for a long time.
Until an ^xFFFF77Anointed^7^xAF6025 Ivory Tower^7, one thing you can do to make your chest better is to look for a corrupted one. There are some very powerful corruption implicits that we would like to add to our build and any of these will make for a great upgrade.
^xFFFF77Implicits to be on the lookout for:^7 ^x8888FF+1% to all maximum Resistances +2 to Level of Socketed AoE Gems +1 to Level of Socketed Gems +2 to Level of Socketed Projectile Gems^7
If you buy a corrupted chest, linking it is very very easy and cheap. Once you buy one, ^xFFFF77Corrupted Jeweller's Orb^7 it to 6 sockets, these are very very cheap and will either add 1 or remove 1 socket from the chest. It will take you ~40-60^xFFFF77 Jeweller's^7 to get the chest to 6 sockets.
Once you have it with 6 sockets, go to the bench and force 4 link it, this will cost a few ^xD02090Vaal Orbs^7 but is not bad. Then, use a ^xFFFF77Tainted Fusing Orb^7 on it, this will be a straight up ^xFFFF7750/50^7 on adding or removing a link. If it goes down to 3, force the 4 link again with the bench. If it goes to a 5 link then it's a ^xFFFF7750/50^7 for 6 links. If you lose it and it goes back down to 4 just try again. On average it should only take 4 ^xFFFF77Fusings^7 to 6 link the chest. Now, you could get unlucky and have it take more, I had a chest take 27 before but for the average person it should just be 4.
This allows us to get a massive massive damage increase for only a few div. ^xFFFF77RIP Tainted Fusing Prices^7
^xFFFF77I have a video guide on how to 6 link a corrupted chest here^7: https://youtu.be/Fqeu9F3IRME
^xD02090IMPORTANT^7^7: ^xFFFF77Recoloring Ivory Tower^7
Since we want ^x70FF703G^7^x7070FF2B^7^xE050301R^7 in our ^xAF6025Ivory Tower^7 to fit in our ^x70FF70Storm Rain^7 6 link, we need to find a way to recolor the chest. The easiest way to do this will be with ^xFFFF77Tainted Chromatic Orbs^7 which when used will reroll every socket with a pure unbiased ^xFFFF771/3^7 chance of each color. This should make it very easy to get ^x7070FF4B^7^x70FF701G^7 and should take ^xFFFF77~40-50^7 at most assuming you dont get unlucky which will cost about ^xFFFF771-3 Div^7 depending on the league.
If you need to corrupt your chest, you can use a ^xFFFF77Craicic Vassal^7 to guarantee corrupt it to 30% with no chance of bricking it.
^x70FF70Belt^7
For this build our best belt before ^xAF6025Mageblood^7 will be a crafted belt. I would recommend using a ^xFFFF77Stygian^7 as this will allow us to get "^x8888FF100% chance to avoid being Shocked^7" very easily with an ^xFFFF77Abyss Jewel^7. This will allow us to abuse ^xAF6025Stormshroud^7 for ^xFFFF77Ailment Immunity^7 very easily.
On a ^xFFFF77Stygian^7, we need to get the mod "^x8888FFx% chance to Avoid being Shocked^7." This comes from using ^x8888FFEssences of Torment^7 when crafting to guarantee the mod. Otherwise, we want to try and find ^x8888FFMana^7, ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 & ^xD02090Resistances^7 on the belt. Finding ^xD02090Resistances^7 is more important than anything else.
I would recommend just buying one, for the price range of this build, there really isn't going to be any belts we can make for cheap.
Ideally, buy one with an ^xFFFF77Open Prefix^7/^x8888FFCrafted Prefix^7 so you can swap it out or craft Mana on yourself. Alternatively, you can ignore the ^x8888FFMana^7 and ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 and get 2 high ^xD02090Resistance^7 rolls to make ^xD02090Res Capping^7 easier.
One thing to keep in mind, ^xD02090ANY Resistance^7 works, you can always use the ^xFFFF77Harvest^7 bench to change resistances around based on your need.
^xFFFF77Trade Link^7: https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Affliction/bw02nMXuL ^xFFFF77More Expensive Option (There will be very few of these)^7: https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Affliction/EqP4gWzc5
^x70FF70Belt Abyss Jewel^7
As for the ^xFFFF77Abyss Jewel^7 you want to put inside, you are going to need one with "^x8888FFx% chance to Avoid being Shocked^7^7" on it. You need to hit ^xFFFF77100%^7 chance and your belt will have at least ^xFFFF7750%^7 but it might also have slightly more based on the tier you bought it with.
In the trade link below, change the total amount of chance to be shocked that you would need to hit ^xFFFF77100%^7. The lower it is, the more jewels you will see meaning you might find better ones.
Other than "^x8888FFx% chance to Avoid being Shocked^7^7," we want to look for ^x8888FF+x to Maximum Mana^7, ^x70FF70Phasing on Kill^7, ^x7070FFIntelligence^7, and anything else useful. You can also save this for the end and use this as a way to get any ^xD02090Resistances^7 you might need.
^xFFFF77Trade Link^7: https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Affliction/r9ol3XzcQ
^x70FF70Weapon^7
The only weapon for this build is going to be ^xAF6025Widowhail^7. ^xAF6025Widowhail^7 is a bow with no stats on it other than a stat that makes or ^xFFFF77Quiver^7 better.
This is by far the best bow available for our build as we need to use that stat multiplication to turn "^x8888FFBow Attacks fire an additional Arrow^7" into 3 ^xFFFF77Additional Arrows^7. Due to the way ^x70FF70Storm Rain^7 and this build works, the more ^xFFFF77Arrows^7 we shoot, the quicker we can reach 10 ^x70FF70Storm Rains^7 hitting 1 target and the snappier our dps will feel.
This means that you want to find a ^xAF6025Widowhail^7 that has ^xD02090AT MINIMUM^7 a ^xFFFF77200%^7 roll or higher, anything lower and you will be losing a whole extra arrow.
The ideal bow in this build will be one corrupted with "^x8888FFBow Attacks fire an additional Arrow^7." This will give you 1 more ^xFFFF77Arrow^7 but as mentioned before, you would still want it to be a ^xFFFF77200%^7 or higher roll otherwise the corrupt does nothing and it's the same as getting a non corrupted ^xFFFF77200%^7 bow.
^x70FF70Quiver^7
The quiver this build wants to use is going to be ^xAF6025The Poised Prism^7. Crafted quivers come nowhere close to it and will be your ^xFFFF77BIS^7 quiver until you have both ^xAF6025Mageblood^7 and expensive ^x3F6DB3Flesh^7/^xB97123Flame^7 jewels worth as much as a ^xAF6025Mageblood^7.
^xAF6025Indigon^7 is going to generate a very large amount of "^x8888FF% increased Spell Damage^7" which ^xE05030Battlemage's Cry^7 multiplies and converts into ^xFFFF77Physical Damage^7. Due to this, any small amount of ^xFFFF77Flat Damage^7 we add will be massively multiplied by the up to ^xFFFF773,600% Increased Physical Damage^7 this combo will give us.
That is why this quiver is an excellent option as it gives us scaling ^x8888FFAdded Lightning Damage per 10 Intelligence^7 we have. Another added benefit here is that we will be using ^xAF6025Widowhail^7 which means we get 3 of these quivers with a ^xFFFF77200%^7 roll on the bow. This means with a decently rolled quiver, you can be gaining ^xD0209060% All Elemental Resistances^7 from the quiver alone while also making the^xADAA47 Added Lightning Damage^7 scale 3 times faster.
^xD02090EXTREMELY IMPORTANT^7: You ^xD02090WILL^7 need to get a corrupted quiver with "^x8888FFBow Attacks fire an additional Arrow^7" Due to how ^x70FF70Storm Rain^7 works, and because ^xAF6025Widowhail^7 will turn this into 3 ^xFFFF77Additional Arrows^7, this corruption is almost mandatory to make the build feel good and have snappy single target dps.
This is the only part of the build that will potentially fall victim to price increases as all other items for this build are very abundant. I'd ^xFFFF77100%^7 recommend to get this over using a ^xFFFF77Rare Quiver^7 as with a normal ^xFFFF77Quiver^7 you will need to figure out how to make up for the ^xD02090Resistances^7 you will be missing.
No matter what you ^xD02090NEED^7 "^x8888FFBow Attacks fire an additional Arrow^7" even if you go for a ^xFFFF77Rare Quiver^7. Unfortunately, crafting one with "^x8888FFBow Attacks fire an additional Arrow^7" is extremely expensive and would be a lot more than getting a corrupted ^xAF6025Poised Prism^7.
Below there will be a trade link to buy a ^xFFFF77Rare Quiver^7 but they aren't going to be very good. Try to find one with an ^xFFFF77Open Prefix^7 to craft "^x8888FF+x to Maximum Mana^7^7" or an ^xFFFF77Open Suffix^7 to craft a ^xD02090Resistance^7 if possible.
^xFFFF77Trade Link^7: https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Affliction/8q8zX6ntV
^x70FF70Gloves^7
The gloves in this build are going to be very simple, we will be using ^xAF6025Shaper's Touch^7. Not only do ^xAF6025Shaper's Touch^7 allow us to get ^x70FF70Accuracy^7 by stacking ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 but they also give us lots of ^x70FF70Evasion^7 making ^x70FF70Grace^7 better.
Later on, at higher budget levels, we will start stacking large amounts of ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 and ^xE05030Strength^7 making the gloves even better. The ^xE05030Strength^7 will give us more ^x8888FFMana^7 and ^x7070FF% Energy Shield^7 allowing us to gain so many beneficial stats for free. For now this isn't important but, ^xAF6025Shaper's Touch^7 is unbeatable at a low budget level and becomes even better at a high budget level.
The only corruption that would be good on these gloves would be "^x8888FFCurse Enemies with Elemental Weakness on Hit^7." This is a very very large dps boost and I would encourage you to pick up a pair. They are also pretty cheap and are always available in high quantities keeping them inexpensive.
^x70FF70Boots^7
The boots for this build are going to be stat sticks for ^x70FF70Movement Speed^7, ^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7, ^x8888FFMana^7 & ^x7070FFIntelligence^7. Ideally, pick up an ^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7 base but any pair of boots work as the ^xFFFF77Prefixes^7 and ^xFFFF77Suffixes^7 are more important.
Luckily, because mana is typically considered a bad stat, there are a lot of boots for us to choose from for very cheap. We can even get nearly all ^xFFFF77Tier 1^7 boots for only a few ^xFFFF77Div^7 making crafting a pair not really worth it until extremely high budgets where we will need ^xE05030Strength^7.
Below is a trade link for pairs of boots. You can soften the search by reducing the ^x70FF70Movement Speed^7 to a lower ^xFFFF77%^7 or by reducing the ^xD02090Resistance^7 or ^x8888FFMana^7 rolls. You can also find a pair with an ^xFFFF77Open Prefix^7 and craft "^x8888FF+x to Maximum Mana^7" yourself.
One thing to keep in mind, ^xD02090ANY Resistance^7 works, you can always use the ^xFFFF77Harvest^7 bench to change resistances around based on your need.
^xFFFF77Trade Link^7: https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Affliction/wK9YBKjhb
Use "^x3F6DB3Grand Eldritch Ichor^7^7" on the boots to get "^x8888FFx% increased Battlemage's Cry Buff Effect^7." This is an incredibly strong mod and is worth ^xFFFF77~7%^7 of your dps when rolled to ^xFFFF7711%^7 using^x3F6DB3 Grand Ichors^7. If you are on a budget you can use lower ^x3F6DB3Ichors^7 but this roll is very important.
Use "^xB97123Lesser Eldritch Ember^7" or "^xB97123Grand Eldritch Ember^7" if you can afford it to hit "^x8888FFx% increased Action Speed^7." ^xB97123Lesser^7 will give you a ^xFFFF774%^7 roll and you will not get ^xFFFF775%^7 until you use ^xB97123Grand^7. ^xB97123Grand Embers^7 are pretty expensive and this is not a big deal to have so you can opt for a ^xFFFF774%^7 roll to start off.
^x70FF70Rings^7
There is going to be 1 ^xAF6025Unique^7 and 1 ^xFFFF77Rare^7 ring you want to use in this build.
^xAF6025Shavronne's Revelation^7 is a ring that gives you "^x8888FF6% Energy Shield Regen^7" and "^x8888FF+250 to Maximum Mana^7" when worn in the ^xD02090RIGHT^7 slot. This is an incredible amount of stats when combined with the up to ^x7070FF75 Intelligence^7 the base ring provides. The only downside is that your mana regen is turned off. This downside doesn't matter currently as we will be using the^xFFFF77 Instant Leech Mastery^7 and we will be running 1 ^xFFFF77Instant Leech Charm^7. Between those 2 you should not even notice you have no ^x8888FFMana Regen^7.
Make sure to use ^xFFFF77Fertile Catalyst^7 on the ring to increase it from ^x8888FF+250^7 to ^x8888FF+300 Maximum Mana^7, this is a big upgrade and is worth doing at some point. If you are going to do that, make sure you buy a ^x7070FFMax Intelligence^7 roll ring to not waste money on a weaker ring.
As for the ^xFFFF77Rare^7 ring, it's going to be the same as the boots. We want a stat stick with ^x8888FFEnergy Shield^7, ^x8888FFMana^7, ^x7070FFIntelligence^7, and ^xD02090Resistances^7. We are also going to try and get 1 high ^x70FF70Dex^7 roll on this ring to satisfy all of our ^x70FF70Dex^7 needs. There are so many of these rings and we don't need anything fancy that crafting one is just going to be a waste of money.
If you want to keep ^x7070FFSigil of Power^7 which is ^xFFFF77~15%^7 of your ^xFFFF77DPS^7, you need to make sure you get an ^xFFFF77Unset Ring^7 if you also want to run a ^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7. You can simply choose to run one or the other but an ^xFFFF77Unset Ring^7 is the only way to fit both.
If the rings are too expensive, you can opt to look for lower ^xD02090Resistance Rolls^7.
One thing to keep in mind, ^xD02090ANY Resistance^7 works, you can always use the ^xFFFF77Harvest^7 bench to change resistances around based on your need.
^xFFFF77Trade Link^7: https://www.pathofexile.com/trade/search/Affliction/KqPQrdyC5
^x70FF70Amulet^7
On a low budget, ^xAF6025Atziri's Foible^7 is incredibly powerful as not only does it provide up to "^x8888FF24% increased maximum Mana^7" & up to "^x8888FF+100 to maximum Mana^7," but it also reduces the ^xFFFF77Attribute Requirements^7 on our gear. This allows us to only need ^x70FF70122 Dex^7 to be able to fit in everything instead of ^x70FF70155 Dex^7.
Make sure to use ^xFFFF77Fertile Catalyst^7 on this ^xAF6025Amulet^7 as the ^x8888FF24% Max Mana^7 will become ^x8888FF28%^7 and the ^x8888FF+100 Maximum Mana^7 will become ^x8888FF+120^7. This is very much worth the cost of the ^xFFFF77Catalysts^7.
As for an ^xFFFF77Anoint^7, the only worthwhile ^xFFFF77Anoint^7 is going to be ^xFFFF77Primal Spirit^7 as it gives us stats to buff ^xAF6025Shaper's Touch^7 and a very large amount of extra ^x8888FFMana^7.
^x70FF70Flasks^7
^xFFFF77Flasks^7 are going to be very simple in this build as there isn't anything special we need except 3 ^x8888FFElemental Flasks^7, a ^x70FF70Quicksilver^7, and a ^x70FF70Phasing^7 or ^x70FF70Evasion Rating^7 flask.
In terms of flasks for this build there is 1 major ^xAF6025Unique^7 flask to consider otherwise we just want normal flasks.
^xAF6025Coruscating Elixir^7 ^xAF6025Coruscating Elixir^7 is going to give us "^x8888FFLess Fire Damage Taken^7" which will overall make this build feel very tanky. The other upside of this flask is that this will make it so ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 cannot kill us. ^xAF6025Ivory Tower^7 already makes ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 go through ^x8888FFMana^7 first but, if we are ever at ^x8888FFLow Mana^7 and we take ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7, we could potentially die. With ^xAF6025Coruscating Elixir^7, this will never happen in maps as the ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 will go to your ^x8888FFEnergy Shield^7 making sure no random deaths happen.
^xFFFF77Normal Flasks^7 We are going to want to run 4 ^xFFFF77Utility Flasks^7 in this build. For the 4 ^xFFFF77Utility Flasks^7 we are going to want: ^xFFFF77Quicksilver^7, ^x3F6DB3Sapphire^7, ^xADAA47Topaz^7, & ^x70FF70Quartz^7 or ^x70FF70Jade^7. All this build really needs is generic tank stats so we are going to use our flasks for that specific purpose.
There isn't much else to say here other than make sure you focus on your flasks. These are with you at all times and are very much an extension of your build. Make sure to upgrade to ^xFFFF77Tier 1^7 rolls when you can as it does make a difference and make the build overall feel better. Use a ^x70FF70Quartz Flask^7 if you want consistent ^x70FF70Phasing^7 and ^xD02090DON'T^7 have a ^x70FF70Phasing on Kill^7 ^xFFFF77Abyss Jewel^7 or use ^x70FF70Jade^7 if you want more tankiness.
^xFFFF77Flask Prefixes^7 On your 4 utility flasks you want "^x8888FFx% reduced Duration, 25% increased effect^7" as your ^xFFFF77Prefix^7. We unfortunately dont have any sort of flask mods in this build allowing us to extend the duration of them but as this build is meant to do high density farming it will always be up.
Another option is to go for the ^xFFFF77Prefix^7 "^x8888FFGain x Charges when you are Hit by an Enemy^7" This will give you 100% uptime in high density maps and might feel better than ^x8888FFIncreased Effect^7 due to the higher uptime.
^xFFFF77Flask Suffixes^7 There are 4 major ^xFFFF77Suffixes^7 that we want to get on our flasks.
^xFFFF77We need:^7 ^x8888FFx% increased Movement Speed during Effect x% increased Evasion Rating during Effect x% increased Attack Speed during Effect Regenerate 3% of Life per second during Effect^7
The ^x8888FFRegenerate^7 mod can only be crafted onto a ^xFFFF77Flask^7 as a ^xFFFF77Suffix^7 on the ^xFFFF77Crafting Bench^7. You can go on ^xFFFF77TFT^7 and buy the craft from someone there or ask a friend or someone in /global 512 to do it for you.
^x70FF70Gems^7
There are some very powerful jewels for this build that we want to be on the lookout for.
^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7 is also a very important unique for this build helping us get an incredible amount of extra Energy Shield making us very tanky.
On a ^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7 you want to prioritize the ^x7070FFClarity^7 "^x8888FFx% of Maximum Mana as Extra Maximum Energy Shield^7" roll over everything else. Outside of the "^x8888FFMana as ES^7" roll, the only other relevant mod to consider is the ^x7070FFClarity^7 "^x8888FFx% chance to Recover 10% of Mana when You use a Skill^7" roll. This will make your ^x8888FFMana^7 more consistent but isn't needed until much later in the build where we fit in ^xAF6025Mageblood^7 and have very high ^x8888FFMana Costs^7 due to an ^x70FF70Onslaught Flask^7.
^xAF6025That Which Was Taken^7 is a new jewel added in ^xFFFF773.23^7. This jewel can roll any 4 ^x8888FFCharm^7 modifiers on it and can be incredibly strong. This is the ^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7 of ^x8888FFCharms^7. We want to use this to either get the "^x8888FFRage per Power^7" or the "^x8888FFx% of Leech is Instant^7" ^xFFFF77Charm^7 rolls. This would open up space to get better rolls on your ^xFFFF77Charms^7. Basically, use this as a filler for any of the ^xFFFF77Charm^7 mods mentioned in the ^xFFFF77Charms Section^7 at the top of the ^xFFFF77Notes Section^7.
^xAF6025Healthy Mind^7 is going to be added by ^xFFFF77Melding^7 to turn the ^xE05030Maximum Life^7 nodes into ^x8888FFMaximum Mana^7 giving you more ^x8888FFEnergy Shield^7. This is a great jewel that also comes with a "^x8888FFx% increased Maximum Mana^7" roll on it making it very strong.
^xAF6025Unnatural Instinct^7 is going to be added on the ^xFFFF77Right^7 side of the ^xFFFF77Scion^7 start area to pick up a lot of ^x70FF70Accuracy Rating^7, ^x70FF70Attack Speed^7, & ^x70FF70Movement Speed^7. Due to us having issues with ^x70FF70Accuracy Rating^7, this is a very big dps increase.
^xFFFF77Normal Jewels^7
We have 6 slots open in this build which we will fill with normal ^xFFFF77Jewels^7. These sockets should be filled with either ^xFFFF77Abyss Jewels^7 or ^xFFFF77Cobalt Jewels^7.
You can use ^xFFFF77Abyss Jewels^7 to get the ^x70FF70Accuracy Rating^7 you are missing. Until higher budget levels where we have a lot of ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 which gives us ^x70FF70Accuracy Rating^7 through ^xAF6025Shaper's Touch^7, we will not be ^x70FF70Accuracy Capped^7. You can also use these to fit in any ^xD02090Resistances^7 you are missing and as a way to get more Mana.
On ^xFFFF77Abyss Jewels^7 you should look for: ^x8888FF+x to Maximum Mana +x to Accuracy Rating Any Resistances you need^7
Otherwise, on ^xFFFF77Cobalt Jewels^7 you just need to find jewels with "^x8888FFx% increased Maximum Mana^7" & "^x8888FFx% increased Maximum Energy Shield^7." The rest of the space on these Jewels can be filled with any ^xD02090Resistances^7 you need or more ^x70FF70Attack Speed^7.
^x70FF70Cluster Jewels^7
There is one ^xFFFF77Cluster Jewel^7 we want to get in this build. We are going to want 2 copies of it as a ^xFFFF77Large Cluster Jewel^7.
We want to use a^xFFFF77 Large 8 Passive^7 ^xADAA47Lightning Damage^7 ^xFFFF77Cluster Jewel^7.
For ^xFFFF77Notables^7, you want to ideally get:
^x8888FFScintillating Idea Storm Drinker^7
As for the last ^xFFFF77Notable^7, any ^xFFFF77Suffix^7 works. I personally like ^xFFFF77Disorienting Display^7 but both ^xFFFF77Doryani's Lesson^7 and ^xFFFF77Widespread Destruction^7 are fine to pick as well.
.
'
